definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: This means that the Earth moves faster along the orbit in winter near perihelion .
sentences.chinese: 这意味着地球在靠近冬至点附近的冬季运行得较快。

definition: perihelion, the nearest point of a planet in elliptic orbit to the sun/lower apsis
aphelion, the furthest point of a planet in elliptic orbit to the sun/opposite: perihelion 近日點|近日点[jin4 ri4 dian3]/higher apsis
ecliptic line/intersection of the ecliptic with the moon's orbit plane
"quarter remainder" calendar, the first calculated Chinese calendar, dating from c. 484 BC
sun, moon and the five visible planets
the solar year/the year defined as the period between successive equinoxes
variant of 曆法|历法 calendar
the sidereal year (astronomy)/the year defined in terms of the fixed stars
